alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:57AM MDT until April 21 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. .Snow and rain to maintain river rises and ponding of water over low lying areas. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 21... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sandy Creek at Havre. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 21. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, At 11 feet, water overflows Road 50. April 17, 2018 Notes: When the Big Sandy gauge was around 11 Feet, Road 50 actually washed out. The water was about 18 inches above the road when it washed out. One 16 foot culvert was in place at that time. The rough location of Road 50 and Big Sandy Creek is about 7 miles north of the casino on Highway 87, then go 3 miles west. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM MDT Thursday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet this afternoon. It will then slowly fall to below flood stage this weekend. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 04/12/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or before this evening at 900 PM MDT.
